questions.text: What university is Sharon writing an article for?
questions.explanation:
New York University.

	Sharon Leonard is a writer for the NYU paper, and she's planning on writing an article about Jerry for it.  In the beginning of the episode, Jerry is trying to contact Sharon at Monk's.

questions.text: For Jerry's birthday, George got Jerry tickets to see a Broadway musical.  What musical is it?
questions.explanation:
Guys and Dolls.

	Elaine is impressed with George's idea and she thinks that she and Jerry might go and see it together.  George tells Elaine that there's probably no chance because Jerry would take him to see the play.

questions.text: What name does George think would be good if he ever became a porno actor?
questions.explanation:
Buck Naked.

	George mentions the name to Jerry, but apparently, he already told Jerry two months before.  George also brings the name up when he's visiting his mother in the hospital later in this episode.

In his apartment.

	Although Sharon was initially supposed to meet Jerry at Monk's, she didn't know what he looked like and they ended up passing right by each other.  At Monk's Elaine and George pretend that he and Jerry are a gay couple because Sharon is eavesdropping on their conversation.  This later puts them in a mess because Sharon thinks they're gay.

questions.text: According to George's story, where did he and Jerry first meet?
questions.explanation:
In a gym class.

	At the time, George was climbing the ropes and Jerry was spotting him.  When George began slipping on the rope, he fell onto Jerry's head, and they've been friends since that day.  George and Jerry are telling stories to Sharon and she ends up thinking that they're homosexuals because of their answers and because of the fake conversation in Monk's.

questions.text: What does Kramer get Jerry for his birthday?
questions.explanation:
A two-line phone.

	Kramer ends up being the first in the gang to give Jerry his gift, and it ends up being the exact same gift that Elaine bought for Jerry.  Elaine ends up returning the gift and getting a new one.  When Jerry tries out the phone for the first time, Sharon ends up finding more evidence that Jerry and George are gay although they really aren't.

questions.text: What does Elaine refuse to do numerous times during the episode?
questions.explanation:
Take off her jacket.

	Elaine won't take off the jacket in Jerry's apartment, Monk's coffee shop, and in Sharon's apartment.  Soon, people begin to pull the jacket off of her, but she still manages to keep it on.

questions.text: What does Elaine buy for Jerry's birthday?
questions.explanation:
A CD.

	Elaine ends up buying Jerry "The Collective Works of Bette Midler" CD after Kramer ended up giving Jerry a two-line phone.  Elaine ends up going to "Guys and Dolls" with George.

questions.text: Who ends up in the hospital after reading the article?
questions.explanation:
George's mother.

	For the second time in this season, Estelle is in the hospital.  After reading the article about Jerry and George, she fell off the toilet and had to be taken to the hospital by the super in her building.

questions.text: What is the name of the woman that George wants to break up with in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Allison.

	Allison goes into a mental breakdown in the very beginning of the episode, and she doesn't believe George when she reads Sharon's article.  In the end of the episode, it is assumed that they break up.
